comment.body: These got moved with the description from the header file.

pull_request.title: Stateful sigs secret key storage callback
pull_request.body:
<!-- Please give a brief explanation of the purpose of this pull request. -->
Added capability to write secret key to file.
1. Create secret key
2. Generate key pair and set app specific context associated with the secret key. This context is used when updating the secret key.
3. Secret key is updated after each sign operation.
4. App manages the context and deletes associated memory when the key is deleted

<!-- Does this PR resolve any issue?  If so, please reference it using automatic-closing keywords like "Fixes #123." -->

<!-- Please answer the following questions to help manage version and changes across projects. -->

* [ ] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [ ] Does this PR change the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming? Does this PR otherwise change an API? (If so, PRs in [oqs-provider](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider), [OQS-OpenSSL](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssl), [OQS-BoringSSL](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/boringssl), and [OQS-OpenSSH](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssh) will also need to be ready for review and merge by the time this is merged.)

<!-- Once your pull request is ready for review and passing continuous integration tests, please convert from a draft PR to a normal PR, and request a review from one of the OQS core team members. -->

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -216,13 +225,14 @@ typedef struct OQS_SIG_STFL_SECRET_KEY {
 	/**
 	 * set Secret Key to internal structure Function
 	 *
-	 * @param[out] sk OQS_SIG_STFL_SECRET_KEY object
-	 * @param[in] sk_len length of the returned byte string
-	 * @param[in] sk_buf The secret key represented as OQS_SIG_STFL_SECRET_KEY object
+	 * @param[in] sk OQS_SIG_STFL_SECRET_KEY object
+	 * @param[in] key_len length of the returned byte string
+	 * @param[in] sk_buf The secret key data to populate key obj
+	 * @param[in]  context application specific data
 	 * @returns  status of the operation populated with key material none-zero length. Caller
 	 * deletes the buffer. if sk_buf is NULL the function returns the length
 	 */
-	OQS_STATUS (*deserialize_key)(OQS_SIG_STFL_SECRET_KEY *sk, const size_t sk_len, const uint8_t *sk_buf);
+	OQS_STATUS (*deserialize_key)(OQS_SIG_STFL_SECRET_KEY *sk, const size_t key_len, const uint8_t *sk_buf, void *context);

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -199,3 +199,117 @@ jobs:
           name: oqs-provider-msvc
           path: D:/a/oqs-provider/oqs-provider/_build/lib/oqsprovider.dll
 
+  msvc_native:
+# Run a job for each of the specified target architectures:
+    strategy:
+      matrix:
+        os:
+#          - windows-2019
+          - windows-2022
+        platform:
+          - arch: win64
+            oqsconfig: -DOQS_ALGS_ENABLED=STD
+            osslconfig: no-shared no-fips VC-WIN64A-masm
+        msarch:
+          - x64
+# - arm64
+# - x86
+    runs-on: ${{matrix.os}}
+    steps:
+        - name: Restore OpenSSL32 cache
+          id: cache-openssl32
+          uses: actions/cache@v3
+          with:
+            path: c:\openssl32
+            key: ${{ runner.os }}-msvcopenssl32
+        - uses: actions/checkout@v3
+        - name: Checkout OpenSSL master
+          if: steps.cache-openssl32.outputs.cache-hit != 'true'
+          uses: actions/checkout@v3
+          with:
+            set-safe-directory: true
+            repository: openssl/openssl
+            path: openssl
+        - uses: actions/checkout@v3
+          with:
+            set-safe-directory: true
+            repository: open-quantum-safe/liboqs
+            path: liboqs
+        - uses: ilammy/msvc-dev-cmd@v1
+          with:
+            arch: ${{ matrix.platform.arch }}
+        - name: Add msbuild to PATH
+          uses: microsoft/setup-msbuild@v1
+          with:
+            msbuild-architecture: ${{matrix.msarch}}
+            vs-version: '[17.4,]'
+            #Only windows 2022 image equiped with msvc of 17 version, build liboqs againt version 16 msvc will fail. 
+        - name: Setup nasm for OpenSSL build
+          uses: ilammy/setup-nasm@v1
+          if: steps.cache-openssl32.outputs.cache-hit != 'true'
+          with:
+            platform: ${{ matrix.platform.arch }}
+        - name: Setup perl for OpenSSL build
+          uses: shogo82148/actions-setup-perl@v1
+          if: steps.cache-openssl32.outputs.cache-hit != 'true'
+# OQS_USE_OPENSSL=OFF by default on Win32
+# if cmake --build fails, try explicit
+# cd _build && msbuild ALL_BUILD.vcxproj -p:Configuration=Release
+# fails:          cmake -DCMAKE_C_FLAGS="/wd5105" -DCMAKE_VERBOSE_MAKEFILE=ON -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX="c:\liboqs" ${{ matrix.platform.oqsconfig }} -S . -B _build
comment.body: Now, which of these commands can be used? It seems, nothing is executed in this branch (?)

pull_request.title: CI: Add ci for VS/msvc build
pull_request.body:
This add ci test for code generated by msvc. 

The full detail is [here](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider/pull/256#issuecomment-1727750617)

It captured a new error by the test msvc_native:
```
test 4
    Start 4: oqs_tlssig

4: Test command: D:\dev\src\oqs-provider\_build\test\Debug\oqs_test_tlssig.exe "oqsprovider" "D:/dev/src/oqs-provider/test/openssl-ca.cnf" "D:/dev/src/oqs-provider/_build/test/tmp"
4: Working Directory: D:/dev/src/oqs-provider/_build
4: Environment variables:
4:  OPENSSL_MODULES=D:/dev/src/oqs-provider/_build/lib
4:  OPENSSL_CONF=D:/dev/src/oqs-provider/test/openssl-ca.cnf
4: Test timeout computed to be: 10000000
4: OPENSSL_Uplink(00007FFB1067CFE8,08): no OPENSSL_Applink
4/5 Test #4: oqs_tlssig .......................***Failed    0.02 sec
OPENSSL_Uplink(00007FFB1067CFE8,08): no OPENSSL_Applink

test 5
    Start 5: oqs_endecode

5: Test command: D:\dev\src\oqs-provider\_build\test\Debug\oqs_test_endecode.exe "oqsprovider" "D:/dev/src/oqs-provider/test/openssl-ca.cnf"
5: Working Directory: D:/dev/src/oqs-provider/_build/test
5: Environment variables:
5:  OPENSSL_MODULES=D:/dev/src/oqs-provider/_build/lib
5:  OPENSSL_CONF=D:/dev/src/oqs-provider/test/openssl-ca.cnf
5: Test timeout computed to be: 10000000
5: OPENSSL_Uplink(00007FFB1067CFE8,08): no OPENSSL_Applink
5/5 Test #5: oqs_endecode .....................***Failed    0.02 sec
OPENSSL_Uplink(00007FFB1067CFE8,08): no OPENSSL_Applink


0% tests passed, 5 tests failed out of 5
```

All the tests have the same error

           name: oqs-provider-msvc
           path: D:/a/oqs-provider/oqs-provider/_build/lib/oqsprovider.dll

+# Run a job for each of the specified target architectures:
+    strategy:
+      matrix:
+        os:
+#          - windows-2019
+          - windows-2022

+          - arch: win64
+            oqsconfig: -DOQS_ALGS_ENABLED=STD
+            osslconfig: no-shared no-fips VC-WIN64A-masm
+        msarch:
+          - x64
+# - arm64
+# - x86
+    runs-on: ${{matrix.os}}
+    steps:
+        - name: Restore OpenSSL32 cache
+          id: cache-openssl32
+          uses: actions/cache@v3
+          with:
+            path: c:\openssl32
+            key: ${{ runner.os }}-msvcopenssl32
+        - uses: actions/checkout@v3
+        - name: Checkout OpenSSL master
+          if: steps.cache-openssl32.outputs.cache-hit != 'true'
+          uses: actions/checkout@v3
+          with:
+            set-safe-directory: true
+            repository: openssl/openssl
+            path: openssl
+        - uses: actions/checkout@v3
+          with:
+            set-safe-directory: true
+            repository: open-quantum-safe/liboqs
+            path: liboqs
+        - uses: ilammy/msvc-dev-cmd@v1
+          with:
+            arch: ${{ matrix.platform.arch }}
+        - name: Add msbuild to PATH
+          uses: microsoft/setup-msbuild@v1

+            vs-version: '[17.4,]'

pull_request.title: CI & cmake changes
pull_request.body:
Fully implement CI jobs for building under VS environment
Align the cmake test file with the VS generator.

NB: The ci change in this commit rely on my pr branch #256. I'm not sure whether should I make pr directly or just wait upstream to merged #256 then make this pr.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -199,3 +199,109 @@ jobs:
           name: oqs-provider-msvc
           path: D:/a/oqs-provider/oqs-provider/_build/lib/oqsprovider.dll
 
+  msvc_native:
+# Run a job for each of the specified target architectures:
+    strategy:
+      matrix:
+        os:
+          - windows-2019
+          - windows-2022
+        platform:
+          - arch: win64
+            oqsconfig: -DOQS_ALGS_ENABLED=STD
+            osslconfig: no-shared no-fips VC-WIN64A
+        toolchain: 
+#        - .CMake/toolchain_windows_x86.cmake
+        - .CMake/toolchain_windows_amd64.cmake
+        msarch:
+          - x64
+# - arm64
comment.body: Am I assuming correct that github CI doesn't support these architecture types? Worthwhile adding a comment? Or completely eliminate these 2 lines?

pull_request.title: CI & cmake changes
pull_request.body:
Fully implement CI jobs for building under VS environment
Align the cmake test file with the VS generator.

NB: The ci change in this commit rely on my pr branch #256. I'm not sure whether should I make pr directly or just wait upstream to merged #256 then make this pr.

comment.body: I set the cmake build type to Debug in ci, which seems a reasonable choice to produce more output. So yes

pull_request.title: CI & cmake changes
pull_request.body:
Fully implement CI jobs for building under VS environment
Align the cmake test file with the VS generator.

NB: The ci change in this commit rely on my pr branch #256. I'm not sure whether should I make pr directly or just wait upstream to merged #256 then make this pr.
